text: :sweat:
that was a brutal game
that whole series has been rough
okc needs to try and force more switches to get Tony Allen off Durant
Tony Allen : KD :: Reuben Patterson : Kobe
but less assult-y in the case of Tony Allen
I saw a guy wearing a Bonzi Wells jersey the other day
hahahaha
yikes
Thankfully (or not depending on your POV) those were the years I was watching the Clippers.
So I feel like I was saved the darkest years. I was like a Clyde/Kersey/Porter era fan, and then came back around when Roy came on board
which I guess just makes me fair weather now that I say it outloud
I think people forget that LA was breaking the franchise playoff point record set by Bonzi Wells
then again - I was cheering for a yound Lamar Odem, Darius Miles and Quintin Richardson
I still have that SLAM magazine with them on the cover
jesus - thats a terrifying stat
ha!
I still have a pair of And1's I got Q to sign
Wow
and a signed Odem jersey
yeah - it was me and like 900 teenage girls waiting for that crew. But whatever - I'm not too proud
Hah
I disliked Brand because of his Duke heritage but I gave him a pass when he was on that team
yeah - I had the same experience
I also get Sean Rooks (their PF) and Sean Price confused in my head a lot - which only serves to make that team seem more awesome
I love the idea of Sean Price as an NBA forward
Hah. Somewhat related, I'm surprised that team didn't record an album
Also, disappointed Allen Iverson's rap career never took off
right?
so is he
The documentary about Iverson is set to debut on Sunday at the TriBeCa film festival
Pretty excited about it
man - I have a feeling thats going to be like: awesome, awesome, awesome, tragic, roll credits.
haha
<https://tribecafilm.com/filmguide/53305891c07f5d44d7000005-iverson>

attachments.title: Iverson | 2014 Tribeca Film Festival
attachments.text: Iverson is the ultimate legacy of NBA legend Allen Iverson, who rose from a childhood of crushing poverty in Hampton, Virginia, to become an 11-time NBA All-Star and universally recognized icon of his sport. Off the court, his audacious rejection of conservative NBA convention and unapologetic embrace of hip hop culture sent shockwaves throughout the league and influenced an entire generation. Told largely in Iverson's own words, the film charts the career highs and lows of one of the most distinctive and accomplished figures the sport of basketball has ever seen.

text: it sounds great. I'm just going to have to wait until I have the emotional fortitude to handle watching someone making a series of terrible choices
I would tear up when they show him getting a plane to Turkey.
Or Detroit.

Question: do you think James harden wears the beard to mask his shame at being a grown man that can't stay on his feet through an entire possession or do you think he just has no shame?
